intro: Echites bicorniculatus, commonly known as the two-horned spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by specialized bracts that resemble petals. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by livestock and humans alike.
